Text: Listen up. The Bushin Festival starts tomorrow.

They're gonna start with the prelims, and then the
heavy-hitters who win that will move on to the main
tournament.

(Waiting until the excitement hits its peak to strut
my stuff won't be a problem since that's pretty
much how I always do things, but...)
Don't wanna take the qualifying rounds lightly...
Exactly.

In order to rake it in during the final rounds when
the stakes are sky high, we're gonna need to gather
some intel beforehand.

Going all out isn't an option, but taking it too easy
wouldn't be good either.
True...

Right now I got my eye on Quinton, a regular face in
the tourney.

(The ideal situation is being someone that looks weak
at first yet still merits watching for some reason, but
that's a tricky act to pull off.)
This calls for further analysis.

Yeah. We gotta make sure our analysis is airtight so
we hit it big on the first shot.
On that note, Cid, we're gonna need some funds to—
Who're the favorites to win?
Oh, uh... The top choice is Princess Iris.

She'll be the first back-to-back champ in a while if
she wins this year, so everyone's super hyped.

Then there's Rose, that student council president who
took top seed at the academy qualifiers.

Lotsa people are stoked at the idea of her bein' the
first Bushin Festival champ from Oriana.
Oh, really?
And that's what I'm talkin' about, Cid.

We're gonna need some funds if we really wanna make
this festival pop—
Isn't there anybody else?

Uhh, there is talk of some ultra super strong girl
from the Velgalta Empire.

And then there's that mega awesome battle-scarred
badass I'm a huge fan of.
Now, Cid, about those funds...
Oh yeah, here's a little souvenir from Lindwurm.
Whoa, this is wicked!

But when the hell'd you go to Lindwurm? You shoulda
invited me...
Wait, no, I mean the money, Cid! The funds!

Hey, no need for that if this's all a sure win,
right?
Ugh...
Um, three sandwiches to go.
Three sandwiches for takeout.

(A bout with one of the favorites is sure to draw
lots of attention.)
(Now I just need to figure out how I'm gonna win...)

I skirt around the edge of the plaza and walk down
the street to the dorms. There aren't many people
around since pretty much all the other students are
back home.

(Oh yeah, Claire got pissed at me because she wanted
us to go back together, too, but I ignored her and
went to Lindwurm. Wonder what she's been up to
since?)

(Maybe she'll be back in time for the final rounds of
the festival.)
Thoughts like that fill my head as I walk.
And then...
Uh oh.
Never let your guard down.

(The owner of the scabbard giggles. She's a pretty
girl with soft features and honey-colored hair—Rose.)

Fancy meeting you here at this hour in an outfit like
that.
It just so happens I have an appointment to keep.
Did you go to Tuna King?
Yeah.

The three of us went there the other day, too.
I found it quite tasty.
The three of you?

Myself, Alexia, and—you'll never believe it—Natsume
Kafka!

(I don't know what's going on between them, but yeah,
weren't they all in the Sacred Land together?)

I heard you guys make for a rough combo, but it
sounds like you're getting along.
Natsume and I have become very close.

Alexia is also a very nice person, so I'm sure I can
become friends with her soon, too.
Huh.

(Yikes, if she thinks Alexia's a "nice person", then
her chances of being friends are slim to none.)

But...I have to admit things are a tad awkward
between Alexia and Natsume.
(Definitely a case of like hating like there.)
Eh, I'm sure you'll all work it out.
I certainly hope so...

I hope the three of us can do something to put the
world on a slightly better course.
World peace is important, yeah.
Indeed.
Say, are you okay on time?

The truth is...I'm going to see my father. And then I
will be introduced to my betrothed, Duke Perv Asshat.
Perv Asshat...
Indeed.
I'll spare you the congratulations, then.

Rose's face makes it plain that this is not what she
wants for herself.

As princess of the Kingdom of the Arts, I was born
with many expectations already upon me. Even so,
I betrayed them all to pursue the way of the sword...

It's a pretty rare move, especially since I hear the
social standing of dark knights in Oriana isn't so
great.

My father and everyone else in the land opposed,
asking what I hoped to gain by making a muddy
mess of myself swinging a sword around.

But I simply couldn't forget the beautiful thing I
saw that day...
And you...?
Me?

No, no one approved, but I didn't have it in me to
completely cast aside my dream. That is the same
now as it was then.

This may cause me to betray the hopes of a great many
people once again. Only this time, it will not be the
actions of a selfish child.
Cid...
Will you believe in me, no matter what may come?
I will.
Sure.
I'm glad we had this chance to speak.
Rose bows and starts to go on her way.
Hey.

I call for her to stop and toss her one of my Tuna
King sandwiches.
Take it.
You should loosen up a bit.
Thanks.
Rose smiles softly.
